overview_of_class:
This is an introductory level Biology course for science and non-science majors. The course will include an overview of evolutionary processes and molecular genetics. The class work will include readings from a variety of sources and class discussions on many popular science topics of today. We will cover the basics of genetics and see how this information can be used today to understand topics such as GMO crops, gene therapy, personal genome sequencing, and the evolution of certain diseases.


There are no prerequisites. This course counts as a distribution requirement for Natural Sciences area 1.
name: Genetics and Evolution
title: WCAS BIOL_SCI 164-0-1 Genetics and Evolution

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Short lectures, class discussions, and class activities.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students grades will be determined by quizzes, assignments and participation in class discussions.
